meanings.definition: A person who attests or gives testimony.
meanings.sent1: The attestant in court confidently shared what they witnessed.
meanings.sent2: The witness was an attestant to the crime.
meanings.sent3: The attestant at the trial accidentally spilled their coffee on the stand.
meanings.sent4: Her expression was an attestant to her disbelief.
meanings.sent5: The attestant's words echoed in the courtroom, leaving a lasting impact.

meanings.sent1: The signed document was an attestant of their agreement.
meanings.sent2: The fingerprints on the weapon were attestant of his presence at the scene.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing trash can was an attestant of a busy day at the office.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were an attestant of the impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The broken window was a clear attestant of a break-in.
